page.lettertext:
fol.149r
Belgia 1590: May.
Belgia. 1590 17 May To my L. Trea
s:
It may please yo
r
L. to bee adv
r
tized that by l
res
w
ch
I
have right now Rxd from
Embden
& out of
Friseland
yt is
signified unto mee that
e towne of
Groeninghen
hath
expelled their Lieuten
a
t Governo
r
for
e
King
&
e rest of
the K. counsell there. They are also entred into parle w
th
the
states of Frise
& there are hostages sent from both
sides. Of this I thought requisyte to c
r
tifie yo
r
hono
r
L. w
th
all expedition, & w
th
all to beseech yo
u
that yf yt
may stand w
th
her
Ma
ties
pleasure, to wr ite her l
re
to
Groeninghen, in such sort as in former letters w
ch
I sent
by an expresse messenger was desired they may bee sent
heither w
th
all possible speed, for
e having of that place
is esteemed a matter of greater importance to these
Provinces
en
e city of
Antwerp
, & there is no man here
that douteth but
t
upon her Ma
ties
letter they will p
nt
ly
condiscend to a good composition. And thus &c.
Hage
. May 17 A
o
90.
